title: Npc Configuration
description: All of the categorized, weighted traits an npc can possess

replacements.description: Traits that are replaced with a user-selected trait. See the description of 'replacement' for an example.

trait_categories.description: List of all categories of traits. By default an NPC can only have 1 trait from each category.

trait_category.description: A list of related traits. Usually an npc to have one of the traits in the category.

name.description: The user-facing name for the trait category

traits.description: List of all traits in one category. By default an NPC can only have 1 trait from a category.

trait.description: An Npc trait, with a name and weight.

name.description: The user-facing name for the trait

weight.description: The likelihood that this trait will be picked. Two traits of equal weight are equally as likely to be picked. If one trait has double the weight of another, it is twice as likely to be picked. If the sum of all weights in a category add up to 100, the weight is a percentage change to be picked.

hidden.description: Whether the trait is shown in Npcs. For example a hidden Npc quirk of 'None'. Optional and assumed false if not present.

bonus_selection.description: If this trait is selected then additional traits will be selected in the specified category. Example 1: In the category of races, the biracial trait will select 2 more races from the same category. Example 2: In the Quirk category, the disablity trait will select 1 more trait in the disability category. Optional.

trait_category_name.description: Must match the name properties of a trait_category

selections.description: How many traits from this category will be selected. No trait can be selected twice.

replacement.description: A trait that is replaced with a user-specified choice for the next batch of npcs. For example, a trait of 'region-specific' in the 'race' category is replaced with user selected race. The replacement for one batch of npcs could be Japanese and another could be Nigerian. This allows quick generation of region-specific npcs in a globe trotting session.

category_name.description: The category of the trait to be replacement. This is needed to distinguish between identically-named traits in different categories.

trait.description: The trait to be replaced. For example 'Region-specific' trait of category 'Race'.
